results_summary: Lengthening contractions resulted in higher FSR than shortening contractions during early recovery (1-3 hours), and WPH supplementation led to higher FSR than carbohydrate (CHO) during later recovery (3-5 hours), suggesting WPH may promote muscle connective tissue recovery post-exercise.
population_specificity: Twenty young men
study_duration: Immediate post-exercise supplementation, with measurements taken over 5 hours

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of collagen protein supplementation, combined with different resistance training regimens, on counteracting age-related loss of skeletal muscle mass in elderly individuals.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding collagen's effects, as it describes a planned study rather than completed findings. The primary outcome will be the change in thigh cross-sectional area, with additional evaluations of physical performance, muscle fiber type, and other measures.
population_specificity: Adults older than 65 years.
effective_dosage: 20 g of collagen protein, two daily doses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of high- versus low-quality protein supplementation on exercise performance recovery after high-intensity resistance training.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in the regain of muscle strength, anaerobic, or aerobic performance between high- and low-quality protein supplements after intense training periods. Performance decrements of 4-24% were observed but were not markedly influenced by protein type.
population_specificity: 12 resistance-trained participants
study_duration: Two training periods, each with four sessions over 5 days

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of soy protein with isoflavones on bone turnover markers and cardiovascular risk markers in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Soy protein with isoflavones significantly reduced bone-resorption and bone-formation markers, improved cardiovascular risk markers (fasting glucose, insulin resistance, systolic blood pressure), but negatively affected thyroid function (increased TSH, reduced free thyroxine). No significant changes were observed in lipid profile or diastolic blood pressure.
population_specificity: 200 women within 2 years of menopause onset.
effective_dosage: 15 g soy protein with 66 mg isoflavone (SPI) or 15 g soy protein alone (SP), daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the impact of daily versus monthly vitamin D supplementation on serum vitamin D levels in adults with diabetes and chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: Both daily (2000 IU/day) and monthly (40,000 IU/month) vitamin D supplementation significantly increased serum 25(OH)D levels over six months, with no significant differences between the two dosing regimens. Adherence was high in both groups, and no significant adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-80 years with diabetes and chronic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of female sex hormone supplementation (FSHS) on tendon collagen and tendon abnormalities.
results_summary: The study found no clear positive or negative link between FSHS and tendon response outcomes (molecular, mechanical, morphological). Combining FSHS with exercise had minimal effects on tendon cross-sectional area (CSA).
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on female sex hormone supplementation effects on tendon).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of fetal membrane weakening and rupture, particularly focusing on collagen remodeling and potential inhibitors like α-lipoic acid and progestogens.
results_summary: The study found that TNF and Thrombin weaken fetal membranes by upregulating MMP9 and inducing apoptosis, mimicking spontaneous rupture. Progestogens and α-lipoic acid inhibited this weakening by targeting GM-CSF production and action.
population_specificity: Human fetal membrane explants (in-vitro model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of quercetin on mesenchymal stem-cell differentiation, particularly its impact on osteoblastogenesis and adipogenesis, including collagen type I alpha 1 (COL1A1) expression.
results_summary: Quercetin (10μM) inhibited osteoblastic differentiation by reducing COL1A1 expression and mineralization while promoting adipogenesis. The effect was linked to Wnt/β-catenin pathway inhibition.
population_specificity: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) in vitro

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether collagen hydrolysates with higher contents of bioactive dipeptides (Pro-Hyp and Hyp-Gly) improve skin conditions more effectively than those with lower contents or a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that collagen hydrolysate with higher bioactive peptide content (H-CP) significantly improved skin moisture, elasticity, wrinkles, and roughness compared to both lower-content collagen (L-CP) and placebo, with no adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate a novel method of Acute Tryptophan Depletion (ATD) using a gelatin-based collagen peptide (CP) mixture to study its effects on plasma Trp levels and related physiological measures.
results_summary: The CP-Trp mixture effectively reduced plasma Trp levels, while the CP+Trp mixture significantly increased them. No other significant differences between the two mixtures were observed in mood, side effects, cortisol, blood pressure, or heart rate.
population_specificity: 29 healthy volunteers (13 from a crossover study and 16 from a separate randomized, double-blinded study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of oral Shilajit supplementation on skeletal muscle adaptation, particularly the upregulation of ECM-related genes, including collagen, in overweight/class I obese adults.
results_summary: The study found that Shilajit supplementation upregulated 17 ECM-related genes, including collagen, elastin, and fibronectin, enhancing muscle mechanotransduction, elasticity, repair, and regeneration. No adverse effects on blood glucose, lipid profile, creatine kinase, or serum myoglobin were observed.
population_specificity: Overweight/class I obese adults from the U.S.
study_duration: 8 weeks of supplementation, followed by an additional 4 weeks with exercise

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of oral supplementation with specific collagen peptides on skin hydration and the dermal collagen network in a clinical setting.
results_summary: Oral collagen peptide supplementation significantly increased skin hydration after 8 weeks, improved collagen density in the dermis after 4 weeks, and reduced collagen network fragmentation, with effects persisting after 12 weeks. Ex vivo experiments showed collagen peptides induced collagen and glycosaminoglycan production.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether zinc supplementation could enhance bone formation and growth in premenarcheal girls by measuring biochemical markers of bone turnover.
results_summary: Zinc supplementation increased plasma zinc concentrations and serum P1NP (a bone formation marker) but had no effect on other bone turnover markers or IGF-I. No moderation by race, BMI, or baseline zinc status was observed.
population_specificity: 147 girls aged 9-11 years (46% Black) entering early puberty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the bone-sparing effects of vitamin C, particularly its role in collagen production and bone health, based on cell, animal, and human studies.
results_summary: Vitamin C showed beneficial effects on bone health, including osteoblast formation and prevention of bone loss in animal models, with human studies generally supporting a positive relationship. However, high doses may increase oxidative stress, and the evidence is largely observational, limiting causal conclusions.
population_specificity: Cell cultures, animal models, and human populations (general, with some subgroup variations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether collagen peptide supplementation, compared to placebo, enhances muscle mass and function in elderly subjects with sarcopenia when combined with resistance training.
results_summary: Collagen peptide supplementation significantly improved fat-free mass, muscle strength, and fat loss compared to placebo in elderly subjects undergoing resistance training. The treatment group showed greater gains in fat-free mass (+4.2 kg vs. +2.9 kg), isokinetic quadriceps strength (+16.5 Nm vs. +7.3 Nm), and greater fat mass reduction (-5.4 kg vs. -3.5 kg).
population_specificity: Elderly male subjects (mean age 72.2 years) with sarcopenia (class I or II).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high-dose vitamin D supplementation (2000 IU) would result in higher lumbar spine bone mineral density (LS-aBMD) z-scores compared to a lower dose (400 IU) in youth with osteogenesis imperfecta (OI).
results_summary: High-dose vitamin D (2000 IU) significantly increased serum 25OHD concentrations more than the lower dose (400 IU), but no significant differences in LS-aBMD z-score changes were detected between the two groups.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents (ages 6.0 to 18.9 years) with osteogenesis imperfecta (OI).
effective_dosage: 400 IU or 2000 IU of vitamin D daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review optical technologies for noninvasive wound assessment, including collagen remodeling, to supplement traditional clinical evaluation.
results_summary: The study reviewed various optical imaging technologies for wound assessment, highlighting their potential to provide detailed information on skin components like collagen remodeling, but did not present specific findings on collagen's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of imaging technologies for wound assessment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review compositional MRI techniques for evaluating cartilage, including collagen-related assessments, in osteoarthritis research.
results_summary: The study reviewed advanced MRI techniques (e.g., T2 mapping) for early detection of cartilage degeneration, highlighting their complementary roles in assessing collagen networks and tissue composition in osteoarthritis. These techniques may improve OA diagnosis and monitoring compared to traditional methods.
population_specificity: Osteoarthritis patients (general mention, no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of vitamin D3 supplementation on bone turnover markers, including collagen type 1 cross-linked C-telopeptide, in black and white children.
results_summary: Vitamin D3 supplementation at 1000 IU/d raised serum 25(OH)D levels but had no significant effect on PTH or bone turnover markers, including collagen type 1 cross-linked C-telopeptide. The increase in 25(OH)D was significant only in black children.
population_specificity: Healthy 8- to 14-year-old black (n = 84) and white (n = 73) children from the Pittsburgh area.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if incorporating hyaluronan (HA) and viable human cells (PHDFs and BM-MSCs) into collagen-glycosaminoglycan flowable matrices (CGFM) could improve cellular in-growth, vascularisation, and re-epithelialisation in wound healing.
results_summary: The study found that PHDFs proliferated more rapidly than BM-MSCs, with HA further enhancing PHDF proliferation. BM-MSC incorporation significantly improved re-epithelialisation in ex vivo models, while HA supplementation increased re-epithelialisation in PHDF-populated IFWM.
population_specificity: Primary human dermal fibroblasts (PHDFs) and bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells (BM-MSCs) in ex vivo wound models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of bioactive collagen peptides (BCP) in treating cellulite and improving skin health in women with moderate cellulite.
results_summary: BCP treatment significantly reduced cellulite severity and skin waviness, improved dermal density, and shortened the subcutaneous borderline in normal-weight women, with less pronounced effects in overweight women. The results were statistically significant for most outcomes compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Women aged 24-50 years with moderate cellulite, including both normal-weight and overweight individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of oral CAPROS supplementation (a standardized extract of Phyllanthus emblica) on cardiovascular disease risk factors, including collagen-induced platelet aggregation, in overweight/Class-1 obese adults.
results_summary: The study found that CAPROS supplementation significantly reduced low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, total cholesterol/high-density lipoprotein ratio, hs-CRP levels, and collagen-induced platelet aggregation after 12 weeks. These results suggest potential cardiovascular benefits for the studied population.
population_specificity: Overweight/Class-1 obese adults (BMI: 25-35) from the US population.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine if fish oil supplementation (FOS) is associated with lower indices of atherothrombotic risk, including collagen-induced platelet aggregation, in patients with suspected coronary artery disease (sCAD).
results_summary: FOS was associated with lower collagen-induced platelet aggregation in patients not on lipid-lowering therapy, suggesting potential benefits for atherothrombotic risk reduction. No significant differences were observed in ADP-induced aggregation among clopidogrel-treated patients.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected coronary artery disease (n=600, subgroup analyses varied by test).
interactions: Lower efficacy observed in patients on lipid-lowering therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pure Gold Collagen supplementation could counteract visible signs of aging, such as skin dryness and wrinkles.
results_summary: Daily supplementation with Pure Gold Collagen for 60 days reduced skin dryness, wrinkles, and nasolabial fold depth, while increasing collagen density and skin firmness after 12 weeks.
population_specificity: Not specified (open-label study, likely adults with signs of aging).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Sonic hedgehog (Shh), regulated by TGF-β, mediates Cyclosporine-A (CsA)-induced alterations in gingival matrix homeostasis, particularly focusing on type 1 collagen (COL1) expression.
results_summary: CsA enhanced COL1, α-SMA, Shh, and TGF-β expressions in human gingival fibroblasts. Shh and TGF-β modulation influenced COL1 and α-SMA expression, with Shh acting downstream of TGF-β but not vice versa.
population_specificity: Human gingival fibroblasts

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of 9c,11t-CLA enriched oil (CLA80:20) on platelet function, inflammation, and endothelial activation in healthy adults at low to moderate cardiovascular risk.
results_summary: The study found no significant overall effects on platelet function, but sex-dependent inhibitory effects on collagen-induced aggregation (significant in women) and increased TRAP-induced P-selectin expression in all subjects. Plasma monocyte chemoattractant protein-1 levels were higher after CLA80:20 supplementation.
population_specificity: Healthy adults at low to moderate risk of cardiovascular disease (n=43).
study_duration: Two weeks for each phase (CLA80:20 and placebo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether carbohydrate (CHO) supplementation could attenuate exercise-induced increases in bone turnover markers, specifically carboxy-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen (CTX), in elite runners.
results_summary: CHO supplementation suppressed CTX serum concentration during recovery compared to the control group, suggesting it may help prevent exercise-induced bone damage. Baseline osteocalcin levels decreased in both groups after intensive training, but CHO was effective in reducing CTX levels post-exercise.
population_specificity: 24 male elite runners
effective_dosage: Maltodextrin solution administered before, during, and after training protocols (exact dosage not specified)
study_duration: 9 days (8 days of overload training + 1 day of high-intensity running)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare different assays for von Willebrand factor (VWF) activity and antigen, including collagen binding (VWF:CB), to assess their interchangeability and diagnostic utility in von Willebrand disease (VWD).
results_summary: The study found that VWF:Ag and VWF:RCo results were largely comparable across methods, but VWF:CB showed discrepancies with VWF:RCo and VWF:Ac, particularly in type 2M VWD patients, suggesting it provides supplementary but non-interchangeable activity data.
population_specificity: Patients with von Willebrand disease (VWD), including type 2M and type 3 VWD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether amino acid supplementation (arginine, glutamine, and HMB) could improve collagen production and wound healing in diabetic foot ulcers.
results_summary: The treatment group showed a significant increase in hydroxyproline concentration (+67.8%), indicating improved collagen production, while the placebo group showed a decrease (-78.4%). The literature review supported potential benefits of amino acid supplementation for diabetic wound healing.
population_specificity: Nine patients scheduled for diabetic foot ulcer debridement.
effective_dosage: Supplementation twice daily (exact dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary astaxanthin combined with collagen hydrolysate improves skin elasticity and hydration in moderately photoaged human skin.
results_summary: The supplement group showed significant improvements in skin elasticity and transepidermal water loss, increased procollagen type I mRNA expression, and decreased MMP-1 and -12 mRNA expression compared to placebo. No significant difference in UV-induced DNA damage was observed between groups.
population_specificity: 44 healthy subjects with moderately photoaged skin.
effective_dosage: Astaxanthin (2 mg/day) combined with collagen hydrolysate (3 g/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of collagen in scaffold-based tissue engineering for esophageal substitutes and assess its effectiveness and limitations.
results_summary: Collagen was used in non-absorbable and absorbable constructs, but stenosis remained a prevalent issue. Cell supplementation reduced stenosis rates, but the optimal cell types and roles were undefined. The study concluded that functional esophageal substitutes are not yet achievable with current methods.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on scaffold-based tissue engineering approaches).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if oral glucosamine supplementation could reduce structural knee damage (assessed via MRI) and urinary CTX-II excretion in individuals with chronic knee pain.
results_summary: The study found no evidence of structural benefits from glucosamine supplementation, with no significant improvements in cartilage damage, bone marrow lesions, or urinary CTX-II excretion compared to placebo.
population_specificity: 201 participants with mild-to-moderate knee pain (WOMAC score ≥25 and ≤100), 69.2% of whom had Kellgren/Lawrence grade ≥2 osteoarthritis in at least one knee.
effective_dosage: 1,500 mg glucosamine hydrochloride daily in beverage form.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if leucine supplementation (compared to an isonitrogenous collagen control) could prevent the loss of fat-free mass (FFM) during prolonged hypobaric hypoxia.
results_summary: The study found no significant treatment effect of leucine over the collagen control on preserving FFM, body weight, fat mass, or limb circumferences during high-altitude exposure. Both groups experienced similar losses in these metrics.
population_specificity: Physically active male (n=10) and female (n=8) trekkers during a 13-day trek in Nepal (mean altitude 4140 m).
effective_dosage: 11.3 g collagen protein (0.3 g leucine, 93 kcal) twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review theories on the pathophysiology of diabetic foot ulcer formation related to the plantar fat pad and discuss current treatment options.
results_summary: The abstract discusses two theories—collagen fibril irregularity due to glycation and fat pad migration—as contributors to diabetic foot ulceration, impacting treatment approaches like fat pad supplementation and claw toe management.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of GH replacement on bone mineral density (BMD) and evaluate its impact on bone turnover, microarchitecture, and factors influencing therapy outcomes.
results_summary: GH supplementation significantly increased BMD (14% in lumbar spine, 7% in femur) and improved bone turnover markers and microarchitecture (4% increase in TBS). The effect was more pronounced in males and childhood-onset GHD patients.
population_specificity: 147 GHD patients (35.1 years average, 84 males/63 females, 43 childhood-onset/104 adult-onset).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether physiological concentrations of testosterone (∼30 nM) could enhance chondrogenesis (including collagen production) in human intervertebral disc cells and mesenchymal stem cells.
results_summary: Testosterone improved chondrogenesis in male intervertebral disc cells, increasing collagen type I and II expression, but had no effect on female cells or mesenchymal stem cells. The effect was linked to testosterone's conversion to estradiol via aromatase.
population_specificity: Human intervertebral disc cells (male and female) and mesenchymal stem cells (both genders).
interactions: Aromatase inhibitor anastrazole repressed testosterone's effects on extracellular matrix expression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether progesterone affects collagen synthesis in cervical extracellular matrix (ECM) and if this mechanism explains its role in preventing preterm birth.
results_summary: The study found that higher progesterone concentrations reduced collagen synthesis in both 2D and 3D cervical fibroblast cultures, with the effect being partially reversible by mifepristone, suggesting progesterone receptor mediation. The 3D culture system more closely mimicked native cervical tissue and showed progressive collagen increase with lower progesterone levels.
population_specificity: Human cervical fibroblasts in vitro (not a human clinical trial).
effective_dosage: Progesterone concentrations tested: 10^(-9) M, 10^(-8) M, 10^(-7) M, and 10^(-6) M.
interactions: Mifepristone partially antagonized progesterone's effect on collagen synthesis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of daily collagen peptide supplementation on skin properties, including hydration, transepidermal water loss, and elasticity.
results_summary: Collagen peptide supplementation significantly improved skin hydration and elasticity compared to no supplement, but adding low-dose vitamin C did not enhance these effects. The greatest improvements in transepidermal water loss were seen with collagen peptide alone.
population_specificity: 32 healthy volunteers
effective_dosage: 3 g collagen peptide daily, with or without 500 mg vitamin C

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combination of soy isoflavones, lycopene, vitamin C, vitamin E, and fish oil could improve facial wrinkles by influencing collagen synthesis and other skin aging factors.
results_summary: The study found that the supplement significantly reduced facial wrinkle depth and increased new collagen fiber deposition in the dermis, demonstrating clinically measurable improvements after long-term use.
population_specificity: Post-menopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of collagen hydrolysate (CH) on skin biophysical parameters related to cutaneous aging in women.
results_summary: The study found that both CH dosage groups showed statistically significant improvements in skin elasticity compared to placebo, with sustained effects observed after a 4-week follow-up. Positive but non-significant trends were noted for skin moisture and evaporation in subgroup analyses.
population_specificity: 69 women aged 35-55 years.
effective_dosage: 2.5 g or 5.0 g of CH once daily.
study_duration: 8 weeks of intervention, with a 4-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of cholecalciferol supplementation on soluble Klotho levels and bone metabolism markers, including cross-linked C-telopeptide of type 1 collagen, in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Cholecalciferol supplementation significantly decreased levels of cross-linked C-telopeptide of type 1 collagen, indicating reduced bone resorption, alongside reductions in iPTH and soluble Klotho levels. FGF-23 levels remained unaffected.
population_specificity: 22 hemodialysis patients with vitamin D deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D supplementation affects bone turnover and bone mineral density (BMD) in obese subjects, with a focus on markers like C-terminal telopeptide of type 1 collagen (CTX).
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation significantly increased plasma 25OHD levels, decreased PTH, and led to a borderline significant reduction in the bone resorption marker CTX. BMD increased at the forearm, and changes in CTX correlated inversely with spine BMD changes.
population_specificity: 52 healthy obese men and women aged 18-50 years with plasma 25OHD levels below 50 nmol/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review strategies for preserving erectile function post-prostatectomy, including the role of maintaining the smooth muscle/collagen ratio in corporal tissue.
results_summary: The study found that maintaining the smooth muscle/collagen ratio through PDE5 inhibitors, vacuum erection device therapy, and dietary supplementation can help preserve erectile function post-prostatectomy. Chronic administration of PDE5 inhibitors was noted as beneficial for this purpose.
population_specificity: Post-prostatectomy patients experiencing erectile dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid and vitamin B(12) supplementation could improve homocysteine levels and subsequently affect bone turnover markers, including C-terminal cross-linking telopeptide of type I collagen, in older women with elevated homocysteine levels.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation significantly reduced homocysteine levels but did not significantly affect serum alkaline phosphatase or C-terminal cross-linking telopeptide of type I collagen. Additional research is needed to determine if supplementation impacts bone turnover markers or bone health.
population_specificity: Older women (65 to 93 years) with homocysteine levels greater than 10 μmol/L.
effective_dosage: Daily folic acid (800 μg) and vitamin B(12) (1000 μg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the clinical outcomes and response to therapy in pediatric patients with collagenous gastritis (CG), including two new cases.
results_summary: The study found that CG in children is a chronic disease with variable clinical responses, where most patients showed symptom improvement (19 out of 22), including complete resolution in 8 cases. Histopathologic improvement was noted in 5 out of 17 patients, but collagen band thickness and mononuclear cell infiltrate did not correlate with clinical course.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (mean age 11.7 years, 17 females) with collagenous gastritis.
effective_dosage: Various treatments included oral iron (12 patients), proton pump inhibitors (12), histamine-2 blockers (3), sucralfate (5), prednisolone (6), and oral budesonide (3).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare human platelet lysate (PL) and fetal calf serum (FCS) for expanding and chondrogenically differentiating human adipose-derived stem cells (ASCs) and evaluating redifferentiation potential of human articular chondrocytes (HACs).
results_summary: PL-expanded ASCs and HACs showed enhanced proliferation and better chondrogenic (re)differentiation compared to FCS-expanded cells, with increased glycosaminoglycan (GAG) levels and collagen type II and X presence.
population_specificity: Human adipose-derived stem cells (ASCs) and human articular chondrocytes (HACs).
effective_dosage: 5% PL or 10% FCS for cell expansion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate how fish oil supplementation affects platelet function tests, particularly in response to collagen and other inducers, in children.
results_summary: The study found that fish oil supplementation increased platelet aggregation and secretion in response to collagen, thrombin, and ADP, indicating hyperaggregation effects. These effects were observed at both the fourth and eighth weeks of supplementation.
population_specificity: 62 children aged 2-12 years (20 healthy controls, 42 receiving fish oil supplementation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how different growth surfaces (including collagen film and hydrated collagen gel) and media supplements affect cell growth, gene expression, and transporter substrate uptake in human nasal epithelium.
results_summary: Collagen growth surfaces (film and gel) did not significantly alter gene expression levels, but media supplements (Ultroser® G and FBS) increased transporter gene expression. Functional uptake of substrates was lower with NuSerum® compared to other supplements.
population_specificity: Human nasal epithelium (HNE) in primary culture.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of human labour and supracervical apposition on antioxidant enzymes and oxidative stress markers in fetal membranes, focusing on collagen-rich extracellular matrix breakdown.
results_summary: The study found that oxidative stress markers (8-isoprostane) were higher in the supracervical site and site of rupture, while antioxidant enzyme activity (GPx, SOD) was lower in these areas, suggesting increased susceptibility to oxidative damage and membrane rupture. SOD supplementation in primary amnion cells enhanced MMP-9 expression and activity, indicating a potential role in collagen degradation.
population_specificity: Pregnant women at term undergoing Caesarean section (no labour) or after spontaneous labour and delivery (post labour).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of vitamin D supplementation on bone-specific biomarkers, including collagen telopeptidase, in HIV-positive patients treated with an antiretroviral regimen containing efavirenz.
results_summary: Vitamin D deficiency was prevalent (88.4%) in the studied population. Baseline osteocalcin levels were lower than normal, but collagen telopeptidase levels were not. Both biomarkers increased significantly after vitamin D supplementation, with osteocalcin showing a more pronounced effect.
population_specificity: HIV-infected patients under treatment with efavirenz.
effective_dosage: Single dose of 300,000 IU vitamin D.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare collagen binding assays (VWF:CB) using types I, III, and VI collagen in healthy controls and von Willebrand disease (VWD) subjects to evaluate their diagnostic utility.
results_summary: The study found that VWF:CB was highly correlated across collagen types I, III, and VI in healthy controls, with type I collagen yielding higher values. In type 2A and 2B VWD subjects, VWF:CB was uniformly low, suggesting it could supplement multimer distribution analysis.
population_specificity: Healthy controls and subjects with von Willebrand disease (types 1, 2A, and 2B).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a 1200 mg/day collagen hydrolysate supplement compared to placebo in reducing joint pain in older adults.
results_summary: At 6 months, the collagen hydrolysate group had a significantly higher proportion of clinical responders (51.6%) compared to placebo (36.5%), though no difference was observed at 3 months. No significant safety or tolerability differences were found between groups.
population_specificity: Adults aged 50+ with joint pain (≥30 mm on VAS) in lower/upper limbs or lumbar spine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pycnogenol supplementation improves skin hydration, elasticity, and molecular markers related to extracellular matrix homeostasis, including collagen synthesis.
results_summary: Pycnogenol significantly improved skin hydration and elasticity, particularly in women with dry skin, and increased mRNA expression of HAS-1 and genes involved in collagen de novo synthesis.
population_specificity: 20 healthy postmenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the tolerability and efficacy of BioCell Collagen (BCC) in managing osteoarthritis (OA) symptoms compared to a placebo.
results_summary: The BCC group showed significant reductions in pain (VAS) and improved physical activities (WOMAC) compared to placebo at days 35 and 70, with no notable tolerability issues. BCC was well tolerated and effective in alleviating OA symptoms.
population_specificity: Patients (n = 80) with physician-verified progressive OA in the hip and/or knee joint, experiencing joint pain for ≥3 months and baseline pain levels ≥4.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of sea cucumber-derived bioactive compounds, including collagen, as sources for nutraceutical, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that sea cucumber contains various bioactive compounds, including collagen, which show promise for nutraceutical, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic uses, but specific efficacy data for collagen are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of sea cucumber bioactive compounds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the functional differences between superficial and deep dermal fibroblasts, focusing on their contractile properties and ability to produce connective tissue, particularly in the context of wound healing.
results_summary: Deep dermal fibroblasts were superior in contracting collagen lattices and producing connective tissue-related proteins (type I and III collagen, fibronectin, TGF β1 and β3, and connective tissue growth factor), while superficial fibroblasts proliferated faster. The relative dominance of mRNA expression between the two fibroblast types remained consistent after bFGF supplementation, except for collagenase.
population_specificity: Dermal fibroblasts from superficial and deep dermal layers (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of biomimetic nanostructured materials, including collagen and hydroxyapatite, as osteoinductive scaffolds for bone regeneration by differentiating mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) into osteoblastic cell types without soluble factors.
results_summary: The study found that nanostructured materials mimicking the extracellular matrix (ECM), supplemented with collagen and hydroxyapatite, offer significant advantages for bone regeneration by promoting MSC differentiation into osteoblastic cells. These materials replicate native bone nanostructure and ECM components, enhancing their osteoinductive potential.
population_specificity: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) isolated from various tissue sources.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the dose-dependent effects of atorvastatin on platelet aggregation (including collagen-induced aggregation), hemorheologic properties, and homocysteine levels in patients with peripheral arterial disease.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in platelet aggregation (including collagen-induced) or hemorheologic parameters between high-dose atorvastatin and control groups. Homocysteine levels increased significantly with high-dose atorvastatin, while folic acid levels were higher in the treatment group.
population_specificity: 100 patients with peripheral arterial disease (PAD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whey and caseinate intake on muscle protein synthesis (MPS) and collagen fractional synthesis rates (FSR) in elderly individuals after resistance exercise, and to assess the timing of caseinate intake.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in muscle myofibrillar and collagen FSR between whey and caseinate intake immediately after exercise, nor between caseinate intake before or after exercise. MPS was similar across all supplement conditions.
population_specificity: 24 elderly men and women (mean age 68 ± 1 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether blocking the GH/IGF-I axis with pegvisomant would decrease collagen synthesis in tendon and skeletal muscle of healthy humans.
results_summary: Pegvisomant reduced serum IGF-I and IGFBP-3 levels but had no effect on collagen synthesis in tendon and skeletal muscle, nor on mRNA expression of IGF-I and collagen.
population_specificity: 20 healthy young males

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential effects of vitamin K(2) on bone quality, particularly collagen cross-links and bone strength, in type 2 diabetic patients.
results_summary: Vitamin K(2) improved collagen cross-link profiles, increased serum osteocalcin, and enhanced bone strength in a type 2 diabetic rat model, suggesting potential benefits for bone quality in type 2 diabetes.
population_specificity: Type 2 diabetic patients (clinical context) and a type 2 diabetic rat model (preclinical study).
